    Benchmarks
    Classification Regression

    Screener Class An S4 class providing the methods to perform a features screening.

    screening_default_gaussian.Rd

    This function performs a feature screening, and return the index of the retained elements in order of significance.

    Usage

    screening_default_gaussian(
  x,
  y,
  alternative = "two.sided",
  method = "pearson",
  conf.level = 0.95
)

    Arguments

    x

    the input matrix, where rows are observations and columns are variables.

    observations

    (optional) indices of observations to keep

    Value

    the index of features to keep.

    Details

    The object consists of 10 slots

    Slots

    method

    the type of screening to apply

    default

    if default is selected, the adopted test is different depending on the response type:

    gaussian

    test is correlation

    mgaussian

    test is correlation (for each gene, one correlation is computed with each response variable)

    binomial

    test is t-test or Wilcox test, depending on the number of observations

    multinomial

    test is anova or Kruskall-Wallis test, depending on the number of observations

    poisson

    test is correlation

    cox

    test is a Cox proportional hazards regression model

    ebayes
    permutation
    resp.type

    the response type

    x

    the input matrix, where rows are observations and columns are variables.

    y

    the response variable. Its number of rows must match the number of rows of x.

    cutoff

    numeric, the p-value to use as a threshold for filtering not significant variables.

    coef

    (optional) an integer indicating the response variable to consider in multi-response data

    maxvars

    integer, the maximum number of variables to keep. If the filtering is returning an higher number of variables, only the most significant maxvars variables are kept.

    default

    list, arguments to the function performing a default screening

    ebayes

    list, arguments to the function performing a screening based on empirical Bayes methods

    permutation

    list, arguments to the function performing a screening based on permutation

    logger

    a Logger

    Author

    Alessandro Barberis Features screening

    Alessandro Barberis Compute the significance of the filtering test for the gaussian family

    On this page
